item.title: リーチ・グループのロイド・エンブリーEICが約30年間在籍した出版社を退任、リーチの編集者は「運営上の問題」をジム・ミューレンCEOに直属する（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
Reach group EIC Lloyd Embley steps down after about 30 years with the publisher; Reach's editors will report directly “on operational matters” to CEO Jim Mullen  —  Lloyd Embley has been group editor-in-chief at Reach since 2014.  —  Reach group editor-in-chief Lloyd Embley …

item.title: ピンキドールのような "非プレイアブルキャラクター "TikTokクリエイターは、ロボットのような反復的なアクションをライブストリーミングで配信し、デジタルチップを得る（Gene Park/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Gene Park / Washington Post:
A look at “non-playable character” TikTok creators, like Pinkydoll, who livestream themselves doing robotic and repetitive actions for digital tips  —  On TikTok, a woman named Pinkydoll with a thousand-yard stare faces you, undulating just enough to let you know she's alive.

item.title: AIの脅威と潜在的利益、知識創造、真実性、法的懸念など、AIに関するウィキペディア・コミュニティの議論を見てみよう（Jon Gertner/New York Times）。
item.description:
Jon Gertner / New York Times:
A look at the Wikipedia community's debates about AI, including AI's threats and potential benefits, knowledge creation, truthfulness, and legal concerns  —  Can the online encyclopedia help teach A.I. chatbots to get their facts right — without destroying itself in the process?

item.title: 情報筋：ボブ・アイガーはオフサイトミーティングで、先週テレビ資産は「会社の中核ではない可能性がある」と発言したディズニーのテレビ部門幹部を安心させようとしている（Oliver Darcy/CNN）
item.description:
Oliver Darcy / CNN:
Sources: in an off-site meeting, Bob Iger tries to reassure senior Disney TV leaders after saying last week that TV assets “may not be core” to the company  —  Bob Iger is seeking to reassure an anxious arm of Disney's business.  In an off-site meeting on Tuesday, I'm told …

item.title: ヒーマンをはじめとするマテル社製玩具の実写映画『マスターズ・オブ・ザ・ユニバース』がNetflixで製作中止、情報筋によると開発費の見積もりは3,000万ドルから6,000万ドル（Matt Donnelly/Variety）
item.description:
Matt Donnelly / Variety:
Masters of the Universe, a live-action movie about He-Man and other Mattel toys, is dead at Netflix; sources: development cost estimates range from $30M to $60M  —  “Masters of the Universe,” a live-action movie based on He-Man and a slew of other popular Mattel toys, is officially dead at Netflix …

item.title: TikTok、増幅、新機能への早期アクセスなどで新進音楽アーティストを支援するプログラム「Elevate」をデビュー、ワーナーミュージックとライセンス契約（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
TikTok debuts Elevate, a program to help rising music artists via amplification, early access to new features, and more, and signs a Warner Music licensing deal  —  TikTok is launching a new program that is designed to identify the next wave of rising artists in the music industry, the company announced on Tuesday.

item.title: 8,500人以上の作家がAuthors Guildの書簡に署名、AIリーダーたちに対し、著作権保護された素材をジェネレーティブAIに使用する際には、作家の同意を得て公正に補償するよう求める（Devin Coldewey/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Devin Coldewey / TechCrunch:
Over 8,500 authors sign an Authors Guild letter asking AI leaders to get consent and fairly compensate writers when using copyrighted material for generative AI  —  If you ask GPT-4 to do a passage in the style of Carmen Machado or Margaret Atwood or Alexander Chee, it will do a fair job at it …

item.title: 米第9巡回区控訴裁判所は、BuzzFeed NewsとTimeの埋め込み画像に関する著作権侵害について、Instagramは責任を負わないとの判決を下した（Andy Maxwell/TorrentFreak）
item.description:
Andy Maxwell / TorrentFreak:
The US Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit rules that Instagram is not liable for copyright infringement related to embedded images on BuzzFeed News and Time  —  Two photographers who filed a copyright lawsuit against Instagram after their images posted to the platform appeared on BuzzFeed News …

item.title: 情報筋カメオ、財政逼迫のため80人以上の従業員をレイオフし、昨年のピーク時から90％近く減少した50人弱を残すと従業員に伝える（Natasha Mascarenhas/The Information）。
item.description:
Natasha Mascarenhas / The Information:
Sources: Cameo tells staff it is laying off 80+ workers because of financial pressures, leaving fewer than 50, down nearly 90% from its peak headcount last year  —  Cameo, the video shoutout app that gained in popularity during the pandemic shutdowns, told employees on Tuesday that it was laying off …

item.title: 破産裁判所がダイヤモンドスポーツによるアリゾナ・ダイヤモンドバックス戦の放送終了を認め、7月18日の第1試合からMLBがストリーミング放送を引き継ぐ（Jonathan Randles/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Jonathan Randles / Bloomberg:
A bankruptcy court allows Diamond Sports to end its broadcasts of Arizona Diamondbacks games; MLB takes over streaming, starting with the first game on July 18  —  - Bally Sports owner Diamond ends deal with second MLB team  — MLB said it will broadcast future Diamondback's game

item.title: ブルームバーグが1月1日にオープンマーケット・プログラマティック広告を削減して以来、同社のCPMは〜20％上昇、平均広告掲載時間は15％短縮、ページ読み込み時間は40％短縮している（Mark Stenberg/Adweek）
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
Since Bloomberg cut open-market programmatic ads on January 1, its CPMs are up ~20%, its average ad-load time is down 15%, and its page-load time is down 40%  —  Page load, viewability, CPMs and clickthrough rates have improved  —  On Jan. 1, the privately owned business publisher Bloomberg Media shut off …

item.title: ペンギン・ランダムハウスの最も影響力のある編集者の多くが、7月17日のレイオフの後、静かにバイアウトを決めた。
item.description:
Shawn McCreesh / New York Magazine:
Many of Penguin Random House's most influential editors have quietly decided to take buyouts, after layoffs on July 17, the beginning of a changing of the guard  —  Penguin Random House, the biggest book publisher in America, is cleaning house.  —  After CEO Markus Dohle failed …

item.title: OpenAI、ローカルニュース支援のためAmerican Journalism Projectに500万ドル、AJPの会員が新たなAI技術を評価・導入するためのAPIクレジット500万ドルを提供（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
OpenAI commits $5M to the American Journalism Project in support of local news and $5M in API credits to help AJP's members assess and deploy emerging AI tech  —  OpenAI is committing $5 million to the American Journalism Project (AJP) under a partnership that will look for ways …

item.title: 情報源Vox Mediaが2018年から2022年まで外部パブリッシャーにライセンス供与していたCMS「Chorus」の使用を停止し、ウェブサイトをWordPressに移行する計画（Axios）
item.description:
Axios:
Sources: Vox Media plans to stop using Chorus, its CMS that the company licensed to external publishers from 2018 to 2022, and move its websites to WordPress  —  Vox Media, the parent company to websites such as New York Magazine, Eater and SB Nation, will no longer use Chorus …

item.title: AMPTPによると、SAG-AFTRAは賃上げ、年金、健康保険料、残留保障の増額、"初の "AI保護を盛り込んだ10億ドル以上の契約を辞退した（Lisa Richwine/Reuters）
item.description:
Lisa Richwine / Reuters:
The AMPTP says SAG-AFTRA declined a $1B+ deal with wage increases, pension, health contributions, residual increases, and “first-of-their-kind” AI protections  —  Major film and television studios offered Hollywood actors more than $1 billion in higher compensation and enhanced benefits …
